The speaker module¶

class speaker.Speaker(name, vocab)[source]¶

Bases: object

experience(situation)[source]¶
get_things_heard(space)[source]¶

Get vectors from things heard by the speaker, to learn correspondence with things known.

hear(utterances)[source]¶

Hear what another speaker has said about a situation. The hearer is supposed to know which situation is talked about. I.e. for now, we assume that the hearer knows whether s/he shared the experience with the speaker. We also assume that speaker and hearer agree on what they have seen.

mk_vectors(know)[source]¶

This creates vectors for each word in the speaker’s distributions. We separate things the speaker has heard (distributional space) from things they know (ideal space). Note: if the same entity occurs in several situations, the count for a particular context is incremented once per situation.

parse_utterance(utterance)[source]¶
tell(situation)[source]¶

Tell some stuff about the situation (in logical forms)

update_sparse_entities(situation, experienced)[source]¶

Assumption: also filling linguistic entities from experiences (not just utterances the speaker was exposed to)
